result.execSummary:
The defendant Darcy A Soderberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: 2015CF00873
Ignition Interlock or any device that can detect impairment, to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be paid as a condition of probation.
Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Disclose to any physician your drug history/dependency.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Follow through with mental health care. 
Defendant to provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained, surcharge is waived. 
Defendant is Not to Own a motor vehicle. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
Commencing Forthwith. To be served in the Winnebago Mental Health Facility.
Concurrent with: 15CF873

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Sentencing Memorandum, submitted by Attorney Benedict.(SEALED by the Court)
Defendant Darcy A Soderberg in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Darcy A Soderberg in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 2, Court conducts plea colloquy. Court finds defendant guilty. Count 1 is dismissed and read in. 

Court orders the following: 
Count 2
Court orders the following:
- Total sentence: 4 years (Initial Confinement:  2 years, Extended Supervision: 2 years) STAYED Consecutive to 15CF873
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- 3 years Probation Concurrent to 15CF873
- 36 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 36 months Ignition Interlock or any device that can detect impairment on any vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant 
- Alcohol Assessment
- Court costs WAIVED
- DNA Surcharge WAIVED- all costs waived in favor of restitution
- DNA Sample 
- Restitution of $4853.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
- Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
- Conditions of Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs. No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner they were prescribed. Disclose to any physician your drug history/dependency. Follow through with mental health care. Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms. Defendant not to own a vehicle.  DNA Sample if not yet provided, defendant to pay surcharge.


CONDITION TIME: 6 Months to be served in the Winnebago Mental Health Facility - To commence FORTHWITH. Concurrent to 15CF873

Defendant Darcy A Soderberg by video with attorney Samuel W Benedict in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Wisconsin Community Services will accept the report by Dr. Collins.  Defendant agrees with the report.  Court finds the defendant incompetent.  Court orders defendant to be transferred to Winnebago Mental Health Facility forthwith for treatment to competency.

Defendant Darcy A Soderberg in court, in custody, with attorney Samuel W Benedict.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Melissa Zilavy, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant filed a motion to dismiss in the 14CT717 matter.  Statements by Attorney Benedict.  Court orders competency evaluation to be completed at the Winnebago Mental Health Facility.  Court will address the motion after the competency evaluation has been completed.  Parties discuss whether the comptency exam tolls the time limits for the speedy trial demand.
Hearing on May 23, 2014 at 09:00 am.
